DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Medical Device Manufacturer Clinical Trial Expedited Safety Report Event Followup Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._A person, enterprise, or entity that produces finished goods._Records describing relevant findings and notifications of unexpected serious adverse reactions and other safety information, which is submitted by a sponsor to regulatory authorities, investigators, and Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs)._An event that must be reported to a regulatory or governing agency._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.
A person, enterprise, or entity that produces finished goods.

Records describing relevant findings and notifications of unexpected serious adverse reactions and other safety information, which is submitted by a sponsor to regulatory authorities, investigators, and Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs).

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.
